title: When I Come Again (Writer's Choice Shorts: A taste of history)
features: Becan, returning home after four years' of trading amongst the Romans, looks forward to marriage with his childhood sweetheart. He's earned the right to marry her and she's waited for him. Or has she?
description: Judge's comments:An excellent slice of history not usually written about. Well written, sympathetic characters and that extra emotional umph which held this reader from first word to the last.

Ideas spring up from everywhere.This story came into being because I 'heard' Becan singing the song and had been reading about interesting Bronze and Iron age sites in Denmark. One site had a house which was not orientated the normal way and there was a bag of Roman coins in a hiding place by the hearth.

Thank you for taking the time to read this short story. If you enjoyed the book, please consider telling your friends or posting a short review. p.d.r. lindsay has been writing short stories for a very long time. Her first publication was in her school magazine and for a while she paid the bills writing short stories for 'the People's Friend' until she broke into the (then) well-paying university literary journals in the USA and Canada, but she still has a soft spot for nice comforting 'Ah, isn't it nice!' stories. In between novels, or when the novel won't move until the characters have sorted themselves out, p.d.r. continues to write short stories and hopes her skills are improving.
